ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to set up studies and plan experiments
I learned the process of collecting data on my own as well as the beginning stages or writing a conference paper.
I was able to learn more about psychology research, including working with several grad students on various projects in my lab.
I learned how to work independently.
Learning how to develop a research experiment, process of developing methods all the way to launching!
Coding, running participants in an experiment, all useful skills and insights into scientific work.
I learned a lot about how psychology studies are developed and run, as well as how to critically evaluate scientific papers.
I learned more about the research process.
I learned how to set up research design and write grant proposals for my senior thesis.
How to conduct independent research

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very open so you get what you put into it
Strengths include clear action items each week and a strong team dynamic.
depends on instructor. Strengths were weekly meetings and that the content is suited towards your needs.

It's great to be able to work in a lab for credit, but I do feel like I ended up spending more time on it than my academic courses, between working in lab, lab meetings, readings, discussion posts, and a final 10 page paper. However, I do think that doing all these things did help improve my learning and enriched my experience actually working in the lab.

Strengths: get a more real sense of how the lab projects work, and interact with many intelligent people in the lab
weaknesses: undergraduates could only do some basic work and sometimes have little grasp of the meaning of the project
I liked how the structure of the course was flexible and weekly meetings were geared towards my needs as a researcher

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if interested in research
Yes, my Yale experience most certainly would not have been the same if I had not joined a lab and delved into research!
Definitely! A great way to learn from those doing research and to help be a part of that research in various ways.
I think this is a great opportunity that allows students to explore their passion and to start research.
Yes because it is personalized.
Yes, it's a great way to gain lab experience!
I think being an RA is a great learning experience and I recommend it to all psych majors.
recommend if you want to get some lab experiences and know more about the field you are interested! It's worth trying.
Yes, if they want to gain research experience
yes, I recommend doing directed research as it sets you up well to write your senior thesis in the spring
